title: Victoria Beckham admits ‘obsession’ with Phoebe Waller-Bridge
text:
Vic loves Phoebe as much as we do (Picture: Getty Images)

Victoria Beckham is a girl after our own heart as she’s declared her ‘obsession’ with Phoebe Waller-Bridge and she couldn’t be more relatable right now.

The former Spice Girls singer shared the nation’s love for Fleabag and, we’re guessing, is just as devastated as us that the BBC One series is over for good.

While we questioned our own obsession with Phoebe and Fleabag, Victoria’s made us all feel a little bit better about it by sharing her own love for the lead star.

Speaking to This Morning, Victoria said: ‘The other day actually, I met Phoebe Waller-Bridge who I was quite obsessed with.’

Erm, thanks for making us jealous Vic. Wonder what Vic thinks of the Hot Priest…

The fashion designer continued: ‘I love Fleabag, obsessed with her. So, the fact that I got to meet her was really, really exciting.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

No doubt the feeling was mutual.

Vic has no problem getting older (Picture: WireImage)

Victoria, 45, also opened up about her determination to grow old gracefully, as they say, and embrace her age.

The former popstar admits that she’s saying no to cosmetic surgery right now, simply because she’s ‘fine with growing older’.

Although she seems to have forgotten that she had a boob job back in the noughties.

She explained: ‘I’m fine with growing older. I’m not trying to look any younger at all. I just wanna look good for my age.

‘I wanna look like the best version of myself. I wanna look after what I have. I don’t really want to change anything. And I’m okay with that. I like how getting older feels.’

Vic added: ‘I’m okay with how it looks, because it is what it is. Everybody is going to get older. [But] I don’t love how it [getting older] sounds.’

Let’s face it, Vic hasn’t really aged much since her Spice Girls heyday of the ‘90s, has she?

This Morning airs weekdays at 10:30am on ITV.

description: Victoria Beckham has revealed her 'obsession' with Phoebe Waller-Bridge and her hit TV series Fleabag.
